para.text: dialog box is used to specify the function that files play in models and to supply default descriptions for files. It is displayed by selecting
pane. Changes made in this dialog box will apply not only to the current project but also to future projects.
The dialog box displays a table with three columns:

column lists the extensions recognized by ModelArchiver. An extension is a suffix to a file name. Each extension must begin with a period. A file can have multiple extensions such as ".2.csv". An extension can be listed with "*" at the end. The "*" acts as a wild card when identifying files whose extensions match the specified extension. For example, the following file extensions would all be recognized as matches for the ".evt.ET_Mult*": ".evt.ET_Mult1", ".evt.ET_Mult2", and ".evt.ET_Multiplier".

column indicates the function of the file in a model. The choices are "Model input", "Model output", "Modpath input", "Modpath output", "Zonebudget input", "Zonebudget output", "MT3D input", "MT3D output", "Other input", "Other output" and "ancillary". Although each extension can only be assigned one file type, some models may use files with the same extension for different purposes. For example, in MODFLOW, it is possible to use a binary head output file from one model as an input for supplying initial heads for another model. In such cases, the user is responsible for ensuring that the files end up in the correct location in the archive structure.

column lists the default description associated with each file extension. These default descriptions will be applied to files added to the archive structure although the user can later edit individual file descriptions if the default description is not appropriate in a specific case.
An edit box at the bottom of the dialog box can be used to increase the number of rows in the table, thus allowing additional file extensions to be added to the table.
The data in the table can be sorted based on any of the column by clicking on the header for the desired column.
To accept the changes to the extension list, click the "OK" button at the bottom of the dialog box.
